intro: Moraea bifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea bifida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
